section.title: Changing the Dashboard Timeout Value
section.para: The default session timeout for the dashboard is 1800 seconds or 30 minutes. This is the recommended default and best practice for those concerned with security.

As an administrator, you can change the session timeout by changing the value of the SESSION_TIMEOUT to anything less than or equal to 14400, which is equal to four hours. Values greater than 14400 should not be used due to Keystone constraints.

warning.para: Increasing the value of SESSION_TIMEOUT increases the risk of abuse.

section.title: How to Change the Dashboard Timeout Value
section.para: Follow these steps to change and commit the Horizon timeout value.

listitem.para: Edit the Dashboard config file at ~/openstack/my_cloud/config/horizon/local_settings.py and, if it is not already present, add a line for SESSION_TIMEOUT above the line for SESSION_ENGINE.

important.para: Do not exceed the maximum value of 14400.
